meanings.definition: Isochrons: lines on a map or diagram connecting points relating to the same time or equal intervals of time.
meanings.sent1: The isochrons on the map helped us understand the passage of time.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the isochrons to see how events unfolded simultaneously.
meanings.sent3: The isochrons on the map decided to throw a party to celebrate their synchronicity.
meanings.sent4: The isochrons acted like time-traveling threads connecting different moments in history.
meanings.sent5: The isochrons painted a vivid picture of time's flow on the map.

meanings.definition: Isochrons: a method of dating geological formations based on the analysis of radioactive isotopes.
meanings.sent1: Using isochrons, scientists determined the age of the rock formations.
meanings.sent2: The isochrons provided valuable data for dating the geological samples.
meanings.sent3: The isochrons threw a party to celebrate successfully dating the rocks.
meanings.sent4: The isochrons were like time detectives revealing the secrets of the Earth's past.
meanings.sent5: The isochrons made the history of the rocks crystal clear.
